newsitem.title: UK: Eagle Star to establish Asia office in Singapore.
newsitem.headline: Eagle Star to establish Asia office in Singapore.

text.p: Britain's Eagle Star Reinsurance said on Tuesday it is to set up an Asia regional Office in Singapore following approval in principle from the Monetary Authority of Singapore.
The office will underwrite all classes of non-life reinsurance business, namely marine cargo, marine hull, property, accident, liability and engineering.
It will be established as a branch rather than subsidiary, to allow the company's full underwriting capacity to be made available to clients and provide a comprehensive service, the company said.
Managing director Alan Howell said the Singapore office would make Eagle Star Reinsurance more accessible to clients throughout the region.
Peter Monksfield, currently general manager Japan is to be appointed regional manager, with responsibility for the Asia regional office and the Tokyo office.
